title: Phil Neville calls up 19-year-old Lauren Hemp for England friendlies as Fran Kirby misses out
text:
Teenager Lauren Hemp has made the England squad for the first time while the experienced Fran Kirby misses out on the upcoming round of friendlies, including the sold out game at Wembley Stadium.

Phil Neville has announced a 21-player squad for the home match against Germany on 9 November and the tie in the Czech Republic three days later. 17 of the 21 players selected were part of the squad that reached the semi-finals of the Women's World Cup in France this summer.

The England women’s team will go from a sellout crowd at a 90,000-seater Wembley Stadium to a ground in the Czech Republic that holds just 6,681 people.

Manchester City forward Lauren Hemp made her senior debut in England’s last friendly against Portugal but has never made an initial England squad. Last time she was called up after Jill Scott pulled out with an ankle injury.

Chelsea forward Kirby missed out on selection, having been withdrawn from the last two sets of friendlies. Her club manager Emma Hayes recently said that Neville must be careful with Kirby as she effectively has “four kneecaps” as a result of previous injuries.
description: Teenager Lauren Hemp has made the England squad for the first time while the experienced Fran Kirby misses out on the upcoming round of friendlies, including the sold out game at Wembley Stadium.
